title: Nerfing Irelia is not the answer
body:
Buffing other tops so they can carry and be a threat is the answer.

Stop catering to the qq's of the marksmen and squishy supports. They need to accept the side effect of being squishy that comes with the way that they build, not have everything else dumbed down for them.

replies.body: I disagree. Irelia isn't just stronger than other bruisers. She invalidates many opponents and Is terribly designed. Some bruisers do need buffs but the fact that Irelia needs nerfs, particularly to her E, is undeniable.

No bruiser should be immune to CC practically dish out a ton of damage as well as not die. No I do not want other people up to her level because it is super toxic and bad for the game. I don't want League of Bruisers. I want League of Carries where you can actually do something about the person you need to shut down to win. The problem with bruisers is unlike carries. They don't just blow up. So having them kill equally built teams by blowing them up one by one is stupid and doesn't work for balance.

Wait i can do this too i dont want a game where carries can kite me for days and days. Where an adc can crit me for 1k even with all that armor and kill me in seconds.  I want a game where carries can only kill me if they are ahead.  Bruisers should be the counter to carries because of the damage they can do while building defense.  But no lets have carries be more powerful at everything and kill me before i can even get to them.

>No bruiser should be immune to CC

But she isn't. She gets 10% tenacity against a single opponent, up to 40% against three opponents. 1v1, her passive is relatively balanced compared to others (Pantheon gets to block some attacks, Darius gets his bleed effect, fucking Teemo, etc). 

Besides, in a teamfight you shouldn't be wasting your cc on her unless you absolutely have to. Wasting all your cc on the frontline (except aoe like Leona's ult) is a quick way to lose a teamfight unless you got a plan.
Irelia doesn't invalidate any top.

No thanks, the bruisers, fighters, or what ever you wish to call them that build 1~2 damage items and then tank but still get to kill people in 1 second is stupid. Especially in the case of Irelia where cc hardly does anything to her, and she runs fast+having a gap closer and cc of her own. You shouldn't be reliably killing people quickly without really building damage.

She's not even a threat to only squishy champions either, even if you're tankier and actually winning her stun is enough for her to suddenly beat you.

> but still get to kill people in 1 second is stupid. 

As someone who plays bruisers plenty, I can say this only happens *early game* if a carry is caught out with no escapes. Come late game, the adc should be able to take a metaphorical dump on anyone. That's why supports go bot lane with the adc in the first place, because of the crappy early game.

There is some reason for the meta, and it's not because everyone else does it.

> [{quoted}](name=tombdragon,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=ERWmQKyt,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2015-03-09T04:49:15.879+0000)

> 
> There is some reason for the meta, and it's not because everyone else does it.

Yeah, and I main bruisers and tanks. I am simply not biased. I rarely have a difficult time dealing with adcs as a bruiser or tank unless they got so far ahead. I don't want to play a game where bruisers get to build 1 damage item into full tank and suddenly assassinate carries like Irelia does.

Positioning is important for that very reason.

If Irelia can reach the carry (yes, I understand how her Q and R work), then the carry is screwed. It happens with almost every ad bruiser, not Irelia specifically. Hence, teamwork and positioning.

Irelia is pretty much immune to cc, where as other bruisers aren't. She is also far more reliable in killing carries than other bruisers thanks to her passive making it difficult to keep her off the carry along with a low cool down gap closer and high move speed.

She's resistant to it. She gets 10% passively against one champion, up to 40% with three enemy champions are around.

If that's immune to cc, then Pantheon is immune to turrets and autoattacks.

It's a strong passive, no doubt, but it's not complete immunity.

It is likely to happen at the current rate things are going. 54% win rate after most of the nerfs that have been happening to top laners. Getting close to perma banned in plat and higher.

Two possibilities on why your solution is not in effect.

1. Riot doesn't believe that is the solution.

2. Riot doesn't have the resources (their balance team is a single digit) for this to be possible. 

Either way, buffing top fighters as a whole is going to be tricky. It failed before, it's not likely Riot will try again until they got their information gathered. Let's just hope the PBE tank-jungler buffs will balance the jungle fiasco.

Bruisers are usually cancer so the answer is still to nerf the outliers.

ADCs will still generally not win a duel vs. a bruiser unless it is a good Vayneor they are massively stronger.
